Cook it

The cooking app that helps easily find recipes and more
Mobile prototype

Overview

Task
Design a user-friendly recipe app, that could be used without a paid account.

Design goals
1. Design a recipe app that will be aesthetically pleasing and easy to navigate.
2. Add the "Search by ingredient" feature.
3. Create branding (design system)

Year
2021 - 2022.

Duration
4 weeks

Tools
Figma
Maze
Miro

Research

User surveys and interviews
From User surveys and interviews I wanted to know more details about users' frustrations when using recipe apps, features they looking for, additional preferences.
To better understand users I interviewed 6 people from different occupations aged 25 to 60. The interviews were done via Zoom using open-ended questions.

60% of users find that the most
appealing feature is search filters

From previous experience with recipe apps, 75% of users didn't like navigation

40% of participants don't want to read recipes without step by step guidance

Main outcomes
In this project User interviews took a special place - I had a chance to speak with PE clients, who's been working with a company for years. My goal was to find out their experience with a website, get more details about any confusions they had, and to find out what in their opinion is the website needs to have, and why they think it's important.

Competitive analysis
Competitive analysis was a very important part of the research. I wanted to understand my competitor's strains and weaknesses. Using the SWOT method I compared the 4 most popular cooking apps: FoodNetwork, Tasty, Yummly, and SideChef.

Affinity map
After performing research I created an affinity map to help me better brainstorm and analyze all data that I have.

User persona
I tried to create a persona that will represent the target user. This step helped me to identify the main features I wanted to focus on.

SOFI

About

Status - Realtor
Age - 42

Status - Married
Kids - Two

Bio
Sofi is a full-time realtor and mom. She loves to cook but does not always have a lot of time to spend in the kitchen. Sofi always looking for new culinary ideas and inspiration. Her ultimate goal is to lead a healthy lifestyle for the entire family.

Goals
- to spend minimum time at the kitchen
- find easy recipes
- healthy lifestyle

Frustrations
- can't find what to cook
- lack of inspiration
- long articles

Information architecture

User stories
I identified user stories for already existing users and ranked them by priority

User flow
In order to see how user is going to accomplish a specific task user flow
was created. I focused on 3 user stories:

Site map

Wireframes
After analyzing user flows and user stories I started with some sketches. This step helped me to brainstorm different ideas and ideate the final sketches for the app's design.

Sketches

Wireframes

First Usability tests
Tests were done via zoom, using the LowFI prototype. I had five participants do three simple tasks.

Tasks that were given:
1.Find if the company has services that you need.
Imagine that you need some maintenance to be done, what steps will you take?
2.Check if you can request to contact a project manager
Using this prototype show me how will you request to contact a project manager?
3. Schedule an appointment for January the 4th
How would you schedule an estimate let’s say for January the 4th?

Outcomes
Don’t change
Layout of design
Navigation was easy to use, participants have done all tasks successfully
The contact form was easy to find and use.

Content changes required
Navigation was changed by combining contact and
schedule appointment forms, navigation buttons were
added to all pages.

Before change

After change

Branding

I feel like branding is one of my favorite stages in the design process. Creating a mood board, helped me to come out with colors, find app's mood and style.

Mood board

Design system

Mockups

After creating the design system, I added design to the wireframes and started creating a Hi-Fi prototype

Mobile prototype
Website prototype

Final Usability tests

For the second round of usability tests, the main goal was to see how users will interact
with an updated Scheduling form that I've changed after the first round of usability tests.

Main outcomes

What I learned

This project was my first experience working with a real client. It was important for me to create a product that will be
pleasing but to keep the idea and style that the company already has. I've learned that testing early is crucial in creating a
user-oriented product. Using multiple research methods helped me to know the user better and gave me a lot of
information about what exactly I needed to update at the website.
